listitem.para: Whether or not to enable Extended Sequence Number (ESN) for the IPsec SA. This option is only implemented for IKEv2. ESN is typically used for very high-speed links (10Gbps or faster) where the standard 32 bit sequence number is exhausted too quickly, causing IPsec SA's rekeys to happen too often. Accepted values are either (the default), yes and no. If either is specified as an initiator, the responder will make the choice. As a responder, if either is received, yes is picked.
If replay-window is set to 0, ESN is disabled as some (most?) IPsec stacks won't support ESN in such a configuration.
